verses.verse: Then the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559>

It shall not go<WH3518> out, but the priest<WH3548> shall burn<WH1197> wood<WH6086> on it every<WH1242> morning;<WH1242> and he shall lay<WH6186> out the burnt<WH5930> offering<WH5930> on it, and offer<WH6999> up in smoke<WH6999> the fat<WH2459> portions<WH2459> of the peace<WH8002> offerings<WH8002> on it.

'And what is left<WH3498> of it Aaron<WH175> and his sons<WH1121> are to eat.<WH398> It shall be eaten<WH398> as unleavened<WH4682> cakes<WH4682> in a holy<WH6918> place;<WH4725> they are to eat<WH398> it in the court<WH2691> of the tent<WH168> of meeting.<WH4150>

'It shall not be baked<WH644> with leaven.<WH2557> I have given<WH5414> it as their share<WH2506> from My offerings<WH801> by fire;<WH801> it is most<WH6944> holy,<WH6944> like the sin<WH9128> offering<WH9128> and the guilt<WH817> offering.<WH817>

'Every<WH3605> male<WH2145> among the sons<WH1121> of Aaron<WH175> may eat<WH398> it; it is a permanent<WH5769> ordinance<WH2706> throughout your generations,<WH1755> from the offerings<WH801> by fire<WH801> to the Lord.<WH3068> Whoever<WH3605> <WH834> touches<WH5060> them shall become<WH6942> consecrated.<WH6942>' "
Then the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559>

"This<WH2088> is the offering<WH7133> which<WH834> Aaron<WH175> and his sons<WH1121> are to present<WH7126> to the Lord<WH3068> on the day<WH3117> when he is anointed;<WH4886> the tenth<WH6224> of an ephah<WH374> of fine<WH5560> flour<WH5560> as a regular<WH8548> grain offering,<WH4503> half<WH4276> of it in the morning<WH1242> and half<WH4276> of it in the evening.<WH6153>

Then the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559>

"Speak<WH1696> to Aaron<WH175> and to his sons,<WH1121> saying,<WH559> 'This<WH2088> is the law<WH8451> of the sin<WH9128> offering:<WH9128> in the place<WH4725> where<WH834> the burnt<WH5930> offering<WH5930> is slain<WH7819> the sin<WH9128> offering<WH9128> shall be slain<WH7819> before<WH6440> the Lord;<WH3068> it is most<WH6944> holy.<WH6944>
'The priest<WH3548> who offers<WH2398> it for sin<WH2398> shall eat<WH398> it. It shall be eaten<WH398> in a holy<WH6918> place,<WH4725> in the court<WH2691> of the tent<WH168> of meeting.<WH4150>

'Every<WH3605> male<WH2145> among the priests<WH3548> may eat<WH398> of it; it is most<WH6944> holy.<WH6944>
